private_information: I arrive at Golden Gate Park at 9:00AM
Travel time from Golden Gate Park to Pacific Heights is 16 minutes
Travel time from Pacific Heights to Golden Gate Park is 15 minutes
I want to meet as many friends as possible and optimize my schedule
visitor.goal: Meet John for a minimum of 45 minutes and optimize meeting schedule

private_information: John will be at Pacific Heights from 7:45PM to 8:45PM
john.goal: Be available to meet the visitor for at least 45 minutes at Pacific Heights

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents plans and produce a combined schedule that achieves meeting John for at least 45 minutes and optimizes meeting opportunities

public_information: You arrive at Golden Gate Park at 9:00AM
Golden Gate Park and Pacific Heights are two locations of interest
Travel times in minutes between locations are provided
John will be at Pacific Heights from 7:45PM to 8:45PM
You would like to meet John for a minimum of 45 minutes

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems targeting the FastDownwards PDDL solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is visitor. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->visitor->private_information} This is your goal: {agents->visitor->goal} Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that models possible schedules and travel actions to achieve the goal. Target the FastDownwards PDDL solver. If some information is missing, do not assume values beyond what you know. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems targeting the FastDownwards PDDL solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is john. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->john->private_information} This is your goal: {agents->john->goal} Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that models your availability and constraints. Target the FastDownwards PDDL solver. If some information is missing, do not assume values beyond what you know. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems targeting the FastDownwards PDDL solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If there are multiple agents, keep their actions distinct.
pddl.prompt: There are two agents in an environment that are planning to solve a meeting scheduling task. You will receive their PDDL domains and problems. You have to orchestrate them to solve the following task: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Keep in mind that the PDDL they send you may be partial or contain ambiguities. A partial PDDL may partially solve a planning problem, but it may require integration from the other PDDL to achieve the goal. Ambiguities may appear in different forms such as different names for the same object. Here is the information the first agent has and its PDDL response: {pddl_visitor} Here is the information the second agent has and its PDDL response: {pddl_john} You need to integrate the PDDL responses of the two agents to solve the task. It is important that you keep the actions of the two agents distinct and produce a combined PDDL domain and problem that target the FastDownwards PDDL solver. Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that models combined schedules, travel actions, and the constraint that the meeting with John must last at least 45 minutes. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
